Articles.Content:
As the Joker once said, "And Here We Go"

I was reading through KSP articles online, looking to see if people mistook 1.0 as finished, when really it will continue development. [Engadget](http://www.engadget.com/2015/04/21/kerbal-space-program-arrives-april-27/) says this is the 'polished version' despite not having clouds yet, but I digress. 

I read through a few different sites until I came upon [Eurogamers](http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2015-04-21-kerbal-space-program-finally-gets-1-0-launch-date) article about 1.0 releasing. In that article they say this:

> 
> Also - hardcore Kerbal fans take note - a physical edition of the game will be the next Gamer's Edition (that's the time-limited special edition venture from Gamer Network - the company which also publishes this website).

A click later and I was brought to THIS: [https://www.gamersedition.com/blog/announcing-kerbal-space-program-gamers-edition](https://www.gamersedition.com/blog/announcing-kerbal-space-program-gamers-edition)

![kerbal-figures-with-background.png](https://images.eurogamer.net/2014/gamersedition/kerbal-figures-with-background.png)

> 
> We're working with developer Squad to create an awesome set of Kerbal-approved collectibles for a Kerbal Space Program special edition - the work-in-progress image above is a glimpse of what we're planning to include, and we'll have more details very shortly.

This article was released only just today, so hopefully I have successfully stolen Squads thunder and posted it here first! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> As the Joker once said, "And Here We Go"
> I was reading through KSP articles online, looking to see if people mistook 1.0 as finished, when really it will continue development. [Engadget](http://www.engadget.com/2015/04/21/kerbal-space-program-arrives-april-27/) says this is the 'polished version' despite not having clouds yet, but I digress. 
> 
> I read through a few different sites until I came upon [Eurogamers](http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2015-04-21-kerbal-space-program-finally-gets-1-0-launch-date) article about 1.0 releasing. In that article they say this:
> 
> A click later and I was brought to THIS: [https://www.gamersedition.com/blog/announcing-kerbal-space-program-gamers-edition](https://www.gamersedition.com/blog/announcing-kerbal-space-program-gamers-edition)
> 
> [https://images.eurogamer.net/2014/gamersedition/kerbal-figures-with-background.png](https://images.eurogamer.net/2014/gamersedition/kerbal-figures-with-background.png)
> 
> This article was released only just today, so hopefully I have successfully stolen Squads thunder and posted it here first! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

OOOOOHHHHHH. Whats all this then?

> 
> As the Joker once said, "And Here We Go"
> I was reading through KSP articles online, looking to see if people mistook 1.0 as finished, when really it will continue development. [Engadget](http://www.engadget.com/2015/04/21/kerbal-space-program-arrives-april-27/) says this is the 'polished version' despite not having clouds yet, but I digress. 
> 
> I read through a few different sites until I came upon [Eurogamers](http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2015-04-21-kerbal-space-program-finally-gets-1-0-launch-date) article about 1.0 releasing. In that article they say this:
> 
> A click later and I was brought to THIS: [https://www.gamersedition.com/blog/announcing-kerbal-space-program-gamers-edition](https://www.gamersedition.com/blog/announcing-kerbal-space-program-gamers-edition)
> 
> [https://images.eurogamer.net/2014/gamersedition/kerbal-figures-with-background.png](https://images.eurogamer.net/2014/gamersedition/kerbal-figures-with-background.png)
> 
> This article was released only just today, so hopefully I have successfully stolen Squads thunder and posted it here first! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Wowie! Want want want!
I look forward to more details. (i.e, Price.)
All I can say wish I can afford it.

Wowsah! That's incredible! Nice researching! And yes, I would say you've stolen SQUAD's thunder about the marketing plans that have been kept secret for months. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I want I want I want. Just like I want my darn KSP legos! SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY SQUAD
OK, that is a reason to keep living. I won't shoot myself in the head this month then.
Yay, KSP Merch!

\*sigh\*

here we go 

I would love some KSP Legos though , that would be awesome
I want an android app of the VAB so I can build and design ships on the fly even if I couldn't test them until I got home. Lego rockets would get to many weird looks at work.

> 
> I want an android app of the VAB so I can build and design ships on the fly even if I couldn't test them until I got home. Lego rockets would get to many weird looks at work.

The Lego Rockets wouldn't get me any weird looks, me constantly saying stuff like, "Noicaziralucric atsah sodnuges zied!" while playing with them would...
Well, now we know what's the prize for the Twitter contest they started last week.
I would love to have Kerbal Lego--even if it's just minifigs; most of the rest I can build myself.

> 
> I would love to have Kerbal Lego--even if it's just minifigs; most of the rest I can build myself.

http://minifigs.me/shop/kerbals-full-set-of-custom-printed-lego-brick-figures/

Ask and ye shall receive. Not official and not actual minifigs, but pretty cool.

So is it just the 3d-printed stuff we can already get packaged in a nice box for 1.5x the price, or is it going to be proper stuff?

I've never heard of this company before and just glancing at the stuff they did for Hotline, Miami, it appears they do their own stuff, but it's hard to say for sure.

Oooo, gimme! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I would totally but that! Let's just hope it's not too expensive, okay? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I would plan on it being expensive. You can check [Shapeways](http://www.shapeways.com/designer/KerbalSpaceProgram)or [Eucl3d](https://eucl3d.com/ksp) for an idea of costs to put those items together, and perhaps just go to them directly for the parts you might want more, out of that set. *(I hadn't checked shapeways in ages, prices on some smaller figures are under $30.)*

Hmm. My guess is that it will be in the range of $150-200 at least. Wondering where the art on the box is from, certainly not from the game.

Like the 3d printed ships, certainly out of my price range, alas.

> 
> I want an android app of the VAB so I can build and design ships on the fly even if I couldn't test them until I got home. Lego rockets would get to many weird looks at work.

That would actually be very cool. Maybe not a full VAB, but something that lets you sketch your designs more or less and import it somehow to the game.
Squad officially announced it now. KSP will also be available on GOG.com, whatever that is.

> 
> As the Joker once said, "And Here We Go"
> I was reading through KSP articles online, looking to see if people mistook 1.0 as finished, when really it will continue development. [Engadget](http://www.engadget.com/2015/04/21/kerbal-space-program-arrives-april-27/) says this is the 'polished version' despite not having clouds yet, but I digress.

>

> 
> This article was released only just today, so hopefully I have successfully stolen Squads thunder and posted it here first! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Way to shoot Max in the foot, r4pt0r. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

This is exciting! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Way to shoot Max in the foot, r4pt0r. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
> This is exciting! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I wonder if Squad ever gets tired of being one-upped by their community. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

How "limited" are we talking here? Available for the first 100 customers and then they're gone? Or are they just saying that to generate hype and they actually have 100,000 ready to ship?

Also, any word on how much more expensive this version will be? I love the idea of getting something like this, but I'm a starving student. If it goes above 100$... I'll probably have to let this one go. Like, on average how much do these G.E. packs cost?

> 
> OK, that is a reason to keep living. I won't shoot myself in the head this month then.

Hey mate, You ok? Shoot me a message if you want to talk...
